definition: to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of
Knowledge is not innate to man, how can we overcome doubt?/We are not born with knowledge, how does one achieve maturity? (i.e. without guidance from a teacher - Tang dynasty essayist Han Yu 韓愈|韩愈)
pinyin: ren2 fei1 sheng1 er2 zhi1 zhi1 zhe3 , shu2 neng2 wu2 huo4
containing_words.word: 人非生而知之者，孰能無惑

definition: who would have thought?/who could have imagined?/unexpectedly
what is true and what is fake
what is true and what is fake
if this can be tolerated, what cannot? (idiom)/enough is enough
pinyin: shi4 ke3 ren3 , shu2 bu4 ke3 ren3

sentences.english: Sometimes, doing so leads to debates about the superiority of one language over another.
sentences.chinese: 有時，這樣做會引起各種語言之間孰優孰劣的爭議。

sentences.english: Which comes first, markets or democracy?
sentences.chinese: 市場還是民主，究竟孰先孰後？

sentences.english: But which one comes first, happiness or success?
sentences.chinese: 但是幸福與成功之間，到底孰先孰後？

sentences.english: "We wanted to prove one right or one wrong, " Ditkof said.
sentences.chinese: “我們想證明孰對孰錯，”迪特科夫如是說。

sentences.english: "We wanted to prove one right or one wrong, " Ditkof said.
sentences.chinese: “我們想證明孰對孰錯，”迪特科夫如是說。

sentences.english: Ask Well: Health Benefits of Red Wine vs.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒與葡萄汁，孰的健康功效更勝一籌？

sentences.english: The prime of life is that fleeting time between green and overripe.
sentences.chinese: 人生盛年是處於青澀和過孰之間的短暫時光。

sentences.english: Inventories are required to be stated at the lower of cost and net realisable value (NRV).
sentences.chinese: 存貨計量應當採用成本和可變現淨值孰低法。

sentences.english: By the time Issa was seven, his father had remarried, and it was time for Issa to go to the village school.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕉七歲前，也就是他上村孰啓蒙時，父親再婚了。

sentences.english: How does life in Britain compare with life in the States?
sentences.chinese: 英國生活與美國相比孰優孰劣？

sentences.english: In Archives Management, which is the first, Execution Supervision and Operational Guidance?
sentences.chinese: 檔案執法監督與業務指導應當孰先孰後？

definition: classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
(literary) (final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 呢[ne5] or 啊[a1])
to wipe one's eyes/fig. to remain vigilant
to rise to action with a determined shake of the arms
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
